donny died youngyou lord took him in all your wisdomlike so many others you took at kai santhis was a hell of a movie gets better every time i see it bought it on laserdisc one of the great beer movies where you sit and laugh more than you should so you and your friends tell each other that youre having a good time while drinking and watching moviesbridges is great  still the greatest underrated actor of our time tutturo is awesome as jesus the psycho bowler goodman is fantastic as walter and buscemi is good as donny the sam elliott character was slightly annoying but that was the only minor bitch i have about this funny funny flickwhen i rate a comedy its based on how many genuine laughs it gets  people saw something about mary and thought it was great i gave it 8 of 10  this is better9 out of 10 dont mess wit de jesus i pull that trigger till it goes clickyou mean coitus

possibly one of the most stylish and amusing films of the 1990s along with pulp fiction and goodfellas this film pulsates throughout with the coen brothers crazy offbeat humour and contains many exciting and clearly hallucinogen influenced scenes all linked together by the common theme of ten pin bowling tbl contains some of the funniest characters ever committed to film most notably the latin american paedophilic bowler played by john no one fs with the jesus turturro  the dialogue in this film is as sharp as a very pointy and sharp thing and this is definitely one of the films that must be seen if you are to raise yourself above all the mass produced hollywood nonsense and gain a true appreciation of what constitutes a damn good film

i think this is on of the funniest movies of all times the characters especially goodmans are so weird that you have to laugh on almost every line they say go buy it i gave it a straight ten also dude people keep telling that the plot is not good or at least not as good as fargos well that may be but  therefore it was so funny and i think that the plot isnt so important here anyway youd miss most of it anyway cause youve got to laugh all the time also try some white russian during the movie itll improve a lot if you dont like it

this picture is just grand man  but like thats just my opinion dude its all about the rug  it tied the whole movie together man  and whats a coen brothers film without a rich man behind a desk and a few weird dream sequencesman  nods to bridges and especially goodman

dude the dude thats his name only his real names lebowskiyour average slob drugs bowling and drinking he has two real friends his bowling team buscemi and goodman and he runs into trouble with a mob looking for another guy named lebowski a rich guy weird comic adventures occur crossed with the base story of a mystery results in a successful movie that works see it see it again

the film is quirky and funny but its much deeper on an intellectual level if thats what youre into  the portrayal of california as the final outpost of the mythic american west is subtle but definitely present dude jeff bridges and his pathetic loser friends are quite content with their pathetic lives and make no excuses as they feel none are necessary this symbolizes the freedom represented by the american west and the promise of the frontier  aside from this however its very funny particularly in the use of film angles and perspectives  dude note the western allusion is suddenly embroiled in a case of mistaken identity a kidnapped millionaires teenage second wife and his efforts to remain calm in the ensuing mayhem in which he finds himself it is well written and well worth seeing especially with a few beers and a few friends

this film is so laid back it nearly falls over a wonderful piece of film making there are so many good points about this film but notably the dream sequences only the coen brothers would put a camera inside a bowling ball and the john turturro cameo as jesus quintana the acting is first class with the casting of a high standard the coen brothers are yet to do a bad film in my estimate and are fast becoming my favourite film makers we need more films like this just a hugely enjoyable film that can be viewed over and over again

its very hard to release a completely original movie and it be worth watching  example  natural born killers  not worth watchingbut yet completely original is one of the best coen brothers movies  the best being o brother where art thou  i am not a big fan of fargo  i like my movies good  fargo wasnt anyways is about americans other favorite past timebowling and a few bums who play it jeff bridges proves he is an awesome actor in this movie playing the dude only a great actor can play a character like the dude and then a few years later get an academy award nomination for playing the president of the united states in the contender the dream sequences in this movie are the funniest i have seen since national lampoons european vacation this movie rocked

i love this movie  people i know usually point out the constant use of the f word but i barely noticed it  the performances are so compelling and the dialogue so inventive it had me from the very beginning  i loved how the dude learned new words and phrases throughout the movie and used them this will not stand man  one small observation even though the dude loves bowling you never see him bowl in the movie  apparently hes so complacent he cant even embrace something he loves

you know you love them  coen movies have that quirky something or other that at times will make you laugh out loud or squirm in your seat sometimes at the same time  the only movie i think that doesnt fit this mold was blood simple less funny than the rest  but it was still very good  some movies are more funny  some are more violent  but there is always a mixture of the two  its refreshing to see movies these days that dont resort to spooge jokes and cgi fx cheating and hiphop soundtrax im starting to ramble  anyway i love this movie  love love love it when i got a dvd player last fall this was the first movie i bought and i have watched it on average of once a week since then  im no expert by any stretch of the imagination but i know a well made movie when i see one and i know when a writerdirector cares for the characters and it really comes through in this movie  and its funnier than anything thats been made in years  even after all the times i see it i still laugh out loud at certain parts  my wife and i quote it constantly to each other  my favorite parts possible spoilers ahead1 the scattering of the ashes its wrong but it feels oh so right 2 the dude in the eagles cab i too fervently hate the eagles and 3 the marmot in the tub so i recommend to anyone who wants a good laugh and a weird plot with some truly loveable characters see this movie  1010

similar to the measured brilliance of fargo the coen brothers joel and ethan again delivered a perfectly structured and aimed tribute to the slacker in all of us the slacker in question is jeff lebowski selfproclaiming himself the dude  jeff bridges gives a startling performance far from his usual troubled semiaction roles like blown away and arlington road and proves himself to be one of the most consistently underrated actors in hollywood the dude reigns supreme in his own personal sphere of creedence white russians and above all bowling  the performance i think can be favourably compared to his last great role in fearless and jeff bridges can be proud of his work as can john goodman steve buscemi even julianne moore and most hilariously john turturros cameo as jesus the uptight paedophilic rival who represents everything the dude dismisses  it seems a brilliant quality in a director im talking about joel coen here to consistently extract good performances from any actors regardless of their standing in hollywood i could keep on about the relaxed directing or the inspired music selection both perfectly complementing the ideals vaunted by the film but i wont  every aspect of this and every other coen bros film is succintly placed within the whole it is this film particularly that makes the coens directorswriters ones to watch  and remember to take the advice proffered to the heart the dude in all of us abides

i havent stopped watching this movie since i first saw it about 2 months ago i guess by reading some of the other user comments that this is the kind of movie that you either love or hate  and i love itthe story is fantastic the running theme isnt particularly complex but it doesnt need to be it puts the incredibly laidback dude in a series of outrageous situations that no stoner should ever be exposed to i guess the funniest thing about the movie is that i know a guy who could be evenly compared with the dude and i suppose im not the only one  havent most of us known or been a lazy stoner at some point the story is perpetually fuelled with a line of eccentric characters all quite different from the dude in personality and lifestyle the dudes interactions with them in his quest to obtain a replacement rug are hilarious especially with the malibu chief of policejulianne moore is fantastic as the artistfeminist millionaire the line she delivers to dude while bunnys porn film is running is a classic the story is ludicrous she says with disdain viewing the porn flick with her critical eye postirony at its besti did think that the inclusion of sam elliot was a needless one essentially the story didnt require the insight of a narrative and although i appreciate the comic value of his inclusion perhaps he might have been better utilised on another projectessentially and i think this is the case with more than one of the coen brothers films is that the dialogue is excellent  it is nearly always the way the lines are delivered that makes the scenes so funny not the actual lines themselves this is true for many different characters in this movie from himself to the chief of malibu police whos scene with the dude is comedy geniusanyway i cant knock it  i love the movie his dudeness is one of the funniestbest characters i have ever seen and i cannot recommend this movie enoughparticularly if youre a middle aged jobless stonerim not by the waymiddle aged that is

my new alltime fave flick  a meandering plot  if you can call it  plot a bit like being stoned and forgetting what you were going to say next  then just changing the subject completely but it doesnt matter  all the characters are perfect  even though we dont see much of turturro and buscemi  jeff bridges is superb  and looking very good  the dialogue and scenes make it a cult classic  and it didnt even make it to my local cinema

what can i say this is one of my favourite films to date the coen brothers have done it again have they ever made a bad film well barton fink was odd but still not bad jeff bridges is the dude literally i find it very strange that the hero of this story is a loafer who just wants to drink white russians get stoned and bowl but it works a treat i found myself getting caught up in their world john goodman played a great role as the dudes friend walter and steve buscemi filled the part of poor old donny the story is humorous throughout although brief sadness is found but even this is used to humorous effect okay it isnt one of the most intricately woven plots ever but the dialogue is expertly written and the characters superb i recommend this film to anyone who is a coen brothers fan that really goes without saying and anyone who sees a bit of the dude in themselves which if we were honest might be a lot of us oh and anyone who likes cool movies

when i saw the trailer for this movie i didnt look all that appealing but when they aired it on television one night i watched it and i have to say i laughed myself to death john goodman and jeff bridges are just so funny in this movie lots of swearing especially from goodman but most of the times its hella funny steve buscemi has a role here to its not that big but he appears in some scenes as bridges and goodmans buddy donny hes pretty funny to though he always seems to be talking to goodman and never bridges john torturro appears in a minor role as well but as all other roles in this movie its hilarious i cant praise this movie enough its just so perfect and if youre looking for a movie with a killer soundtrack this is just for you

i checked this site and couldnt believe the low rating that this film received  i know youre thinking that 78 isnt particularly poor but it is my belief that the majority of those who have rated it have only seen the film once  okay so you might not be into the whole multiple viewing thing but give this film a second chance and i promise that you will notice one of the most sidesplittingly funny films youve ever seenjohn goodman gives a career best as the nam veteran with a chip on his shoulder and jeff bridges was born to play jeff the dude lebowski  i have watched this film so many times that i have lost count and still new sh comes to light every time i see ityouve seen it once now why dont you give it a second chance  if you do watch this film for the second time and enjoy it more than the first you can contact me to express your opinions  even contact me if you still believe that it is poor and i will eat my hat

it seems to me that most people who do not like have only seen it once i hated after the first time i saw it but then i saw it again and cant stop watching it i had to go out and buy it the next day ive been trying to figure out what its all about cause it seems to portray itself as really being about nothing but there are all these different characters that portray different ideologies and perspectives like nihilism or feminism or capitalism or fascism pacifism especially the list goes on the movie seems to be about the struggle of these different ideologies during a time of war that no one seems to care about i know everyone says jeff bridges does a good job but personally i think john goodman does one of the best acting jobs ive ever seen of which the writing has a lot to do with the only thing i have no idea whatsoever that belongs in this movie is sam elliot am i wrong i mean who drinks sasperilla anyway haha but i do highly recommend this movie one of the few films i can watch over and over and enjoy more every time

for the life of me i couldnt understand the acclaim the coen brothers achieved over the years i could tell their films were wellcrafted and executed but they didnt strike me as anything remarkable i was particularly puzzled over the success of fargo which i initially found monotonous and flat then i saw and my attitude about the coen brothers changed 360 degrees this explained to me perfectly that  in my estimation  the coen brothers films are not about stories as much as they are studies of culture and characters however lively or lazy the plot may be  its beside the point the joy is to be found in the dialogue of the characters and the world they inhabit has easily make itself one on my favorite films of the 1990sset in los angeles in the early 1990s jeff bridges seems to smile and grimace with delight as jeff the dude lebowksi a lofty 40something pothead who wastes his days smoking pot and drinking white russians while practically living inside his regular hangout  a bowling alley the dude is accompanied by his buddies walter john goodman in a hysterical performance of an angry triggerhappy veteran and the babbling clueless donnie steve buscemi the dude is soon mistaken for a millionaire with the same name as his whose trophy wife bunny has racked up a debt with a local pornographer it seems bunny has been kidnapped for ransom and the real lebowski hence the title would like the dude to serve as his courier for the payoffs daughter  a pretentious performance artist played by the alwaysreliable julianne moore  intervenes suggesting that the instructions the dude has received from her father may be misleading  a series of complications ensue that involve a private eye a missing toe a sacred jewish holiday a trio of bumbling germans and the dudes beloved rug that really tied the room togetherdamn i may never tire of seeing this film the ingenuity the coens display here is endless and tireless have you ever noticed that so many coen brothers films feature characters you love to watch but would probably hate to know in person jeff bridges totally redefines his breadth as an actor by completely disappearing beneath the dudes shaggy beard sloppy wardrobe profane vocabulary and rotund pot belly for a character who seems pretty clueless we have an easy  enjoyable time following the dude through his travails employing john goodman again the coen brothers put him to terrific use as a gunloving veteran obsessed with making a spectacle to enforce his point no matter where he is as well as honoring the religious duties of his exwife despite the fact that hes not jewish but nonetheless pledges himself to it shomer fking shabbus  most great filmmakers have themes and  or  an era they tend to revisit over  over this is not evident with the coen brothers like stanley kubrick and mike nichols the only reoccurring element in all of their films are that they are well made and very unique from all others if youre not sold on the idea of seeing yet its worth viewing just for seeing the view from inside a bowling ball as it travels down an alley this is a wild wacky movie thats nonetheless intelligent and crafty basically the big lebowksi is a dumb comedy for smart people

this movie is so fun to watch the coen brothers are magicians with dialogue and characters i love their style of filmmaking and writing this film like many of their films is very characterdriven a great soundtrack and some great cinematography round out this effort this film gets quoted by my friends and i as much as any film there is if you get a chance go rent this coen classic right now as a matter of fact get them all910

is one of those movies that i didnt love the first time i saw it but now that i have seen it 20 times i love it  now just the thought of watching it makes me laugh  i am laughing while i am putting it in the dvd player and i am laughing now as i think about jeff bridges playing detective all of a sudden and finding a cartoon picture of a man with an enormous penis on the pad that jackie treehorn had scribbled on  i mean come on is this not cinematic genius  whatever the reasons this film just gets better the more times you see it similar in that regard to office space  this is one of the funniest movies i have ever seenhe doesnt care about anything hes a nihilistmust be exhausting

my friends and i have seen this several times and we agree that it is a dark comedy up there with dr strangelove  it has elements of greatness on so many levels that are not apparent at first the bad box office turnouts were easily overshadowed by its popularity in rental and vhsdvd sales very similar to what happened to a lot of great movies such as blade runneressentially this film in a nutshell is about a slacker in the early nineties whom in the first several minutes is beaten up by two thugs in his own home one of which soils his rug then realizing that they kicked the proverbial crap out of the wrong guy they leave  this slacker lebowski goes on an odyssey to find the men who saturated his carpet which ultimately gets him mixed up in a kidnapping case involving german nihilists trying to cut off his genitalia including a late night bathroom attack by a trained attack marmotlots of memorable scenes characters such as jesus the perverted bowler and very twisted humor some of which may be considered offensive seeing as a scant several scenes features brief nudityits symbolic for society some might say as is a very achieved man where as the hero the little lebowski is a foulmouthed slacker but in the end through confusion the little lebowski turns out to have been taken advantage ofa four star comedy

the coen brothers have scaled dizzy heights in the 1990s  barton fink and millers crossing showed an outstanding knack for serious comedy if such a phrase can be used  the unfortunate failure of the hudsucker proxy was followed by fargo their most critical and commercially successful film to date  when came out in 1998 it was met with some critical division and was not the commercial success many had envisioned it to be  it is a shame because is an outstanding comedy filled with great characters and brilliant dialogue  it is also technically superb with meticulous attention paid to every detail  add in careertopping roles from jeff bridges and john goodman and you have a movie that will be held in the same esteem as some of the greatest comedies everits los angeles 1991  jeff the dude lebowski bridges is mistaken for another jeffery lebowski a millionaire paraplegic whose young trophy wife has been acumilating debts around los angeles  the dude as he is known has his home invaded by some thugs who have come to collect the debt  when realising he is not the correct lebowski they urinate on his rug  angry the dude seeks payment from the other lebowski for a replacement rugthe dude a sort of hippy who has only slightly modernised and grown up since the 60s  all the dude does is bowl drive around and get stoned  what is so great about the dude is the ease at which bridges plays the character it is almost the perfect role for him  with long shoulder length hair a goatee beard and pajama like attire the dude is slacker cool before it became a early to mid 90s chic  the dudes friends are similarly eccentric the dim and permanently off the ball donny steve buscemi and the aggressive walter sobchak john goodman who is caught up in the past especially his experiences in vietnam  why the dude hangs out with such different characters is unusual but it only adds to the comic genius of the filmother characters are superb as well  phillip seymour hoffman is excellent as brandt the anallyretentive assistant to who is also brilliantly played by david huddleston  however perhaps the most memorable character is jesus quintala a bowling opponent of the three friends played by coen brothers stalwart john turturro jesus is a hilariously disgusting latino bowler who wears skintight pink and blue jumpsuits to his bowling games  this character almost outshines the dude as the most fun character to watchfurther on in the story the dude walter and donny get caught up in a botched kidnapping plot which is sometimes confusing and ultimately anticlimatic  this film is more a series of hilarious vignettes rather than a cohesive story  the film is packed with witty memorable quotes that hit the mark more often than you think  the coen brothers construct outstanding set pieces the dolly and slow motion tracking shots of the bowling hall the dudes dream sequence and the citizen kanelike drawing room of  all of these combined with the fine performances make this an unforgettable comedy

this is one of the funniest movies i have ever seen smart clever and very well acted very refreshing thank god for joel and ethan coen jeff bridges is absolutely hilarious as the dude and john goodman what can i say priceless philip seymour hoffman made me laugh so hard and i dont think he was supposed to highly recommended

i have seen this movie more than a dozen times i often just play it on the dvd while i am doing something else why  well this movie is unlike any other one i have ever watched  you cannot really categorize it in a particular genre  it is unique it is funny the performances are outstanding and the story line is very original  the best thing about the story itself is its simplicity for the lack of a better word  this movie does not try to teach us or get a point across it is just about dudes life who enjoys doing nothing  now the coens took dudes life and turned it to one of the funniest wittiest and most amusing movie of all times  the soundtrack complements the story very well the coens always seem to have the perfect touch for their soundtrack choice and sam elliots voice for the narration was the perfect choice that being said i just have to watch the movie again

this is by far my favorite comedy of all time  the acting is so real and the situation is so insane that it probably has happened somewhere out there  jeff bridges john goodman steve buscemi and john turturro all give excellent performances and give the movie such depth that you cant help but grow to know and love there characters  the music is terrific especially just dropped in by kenny rogers and the new edition which is now one of my favorite songs  this is one of those movies that if you carried the script in your pocket could provide you with a thought provoking and extremely hilarious quote for any occasion  truly a masterpiece

this is quite possibly the funniest film ive ever seen  the more i think about it the better it gets  there are so many classic scenes in this movie that just stick in your memory and never lose their hilarity jeff bridges is stunningly good as the dude and john goodmans performance is as ever brilliant  john turturro also appears in surely one of the most memorable and humorous cameos in cinema history as the perverted rival bowler jesus  my only gripe is that the vast talents of steve buscemi were a little wasted in his relatively small role but he still shone through as the timid donny it is impossible to list all the great points of this film  see it at the cinema then rent it then buy the video  i know i will

this is a great movie or you love it or you hate it the thing with is that the whole story isnt that important its all about the weird characters and the conversations plus that it has a great soundtrack and the you get to see the nicest shots of the beautiful game of bowling even viewed from inside of a ballits about this guy named the dudebridges whose real name is lebowski  that usually hangs at the bowling with the crazy vietnamveteran walter goodman who screws up everything and the shy little guy named donny buscemi the dude comes home after another day of bowling and finds 2 guys in his house that are after a lebowski but after a little brainstorming they realize that this isnt the rich lebowski they were looking for before leavingone of the intruders the chinaman urinates on the dudes rug the rug that really tied his room together but the dude is gonna do something about it this aggression will not stand manthe next day dude decides to go to the lebowski they were looking for to report the incident and to maybe get some money for a new rug this is the beginning of a hilarious adventure with very funny scenessee this masterpiece by the brothers coen and laugh your head offyou can watch it more than once

is simply put as a hilarious movie  the characters are funny for many reasons  the dude minding his own buisiness walks into his house and is ruffed up by two thugs  as they leave one of them pes on his rug  after that event a bunch of other bad things happen to him hes just this incredibly confused unemployed pothead and his entire life is changed just because he has the same name of a millionaire whos wife owes money all over town  the plot wanders and changes so much that sometimes you have to pause the movie and ask someone next to you what is going on the characters in this movie especially john goodmans character walter sobchak are just so funny that its hard to describe  walters always rambling on about something stupid that has nothing to do with the subject like how he fought in vietnam and scolding donnie for just asking a question  this movie has a good plot good characters and good dialogue the music also isnt bad creedence clearwater revival or creedence as referred to in the movie bob dylan and kenny rogers are included not too shabby  rent this movie  youll be satisfied  enjoy

has got to be one of the funniest movies ive seen in a long time the film centers on the dude jeff bridges a white russian drinking hippieslacker who is seeking reparations for his soiled rug and is then ensnared in a sinister kidnapping schemealthough the convoluted plot makes less sense the more you think about it where this film really shines is its ensemble of colorful characters and much of its humor is derived from quirks in their personality in an era where it seems most movie characters are nothing more than one dimensional cardboard cutouts it is refreshing to see fully fleshed out characters in a good example of this is the dudes bowling buddy walter sobchak john goodman at first glance he seems like a pretty shallow character a boorish belligerant loudmouth he has no second thoughts about smashing up a corvette or biting a nihilists ear off to aid the dudes quest however when it comes to issues in his own life he is rather powerless notice that when the flamboyant trash talking bowler jesus quintata taunts walter he just sits meekly and takes the abuse he takes care of his exwifes dog without any protest and is still observes her religion judiaism walters character flaws in turn causes the normally mellow dude to lose his cooloh look at me im rambling again this is just one fun movie to watch with a message that just bumbling through life doing nothing isnt such a bad thing whenever im feeling down watching it cheers right back up definitely recommended

the coen brothers big lebowski is without a doubt the best comedy movie of all time jeff bridges plays the character of the lazy potsmoking dude so well you actually believe the hilarious remarks he makes are genuine his friend walter john goodman is the stereotypical vietnam vet that manages to relate everything to vietnam no matter how remote the situation is this movie is great aphrodisiac after a long stressful day at school or work unlike most comedy movies gets better every time you watch it i recommend that a person watch it at least twice to get the full effect of the coen brothers genius better yet buy the video or dvd this movie just keeps getting funnier every time
