this is my number two all time favorite movie why this movie is an onion even now years after its release i watch it and the layers unfold what i have discovered is that the movies that somehow mysteriously move me in unknown ways upon the first viewing turn out to be religious metaphors blade runner pretty obvious if you at least a faint whiff of imaginative ability is more subtle watch the movie and count how many times jesus is said was jesus betrayed by the jews he was in tbl its all there an immaculate conception a betrayal a crucifixion a rebirth who is the jesus metaphor its the car the car carries the characters throughout the movie and is sacrificed in the end by nihilists the car carries the reward the million dollars that turns out not to be there because the money is not the reward bowling is the reward donny is reborn as the dude and walter return to the lanes the idolater falls maude becomes the next mary magdelene walter is paul the dude is john not even the cohen brothers can escape the judeochristian core of our society of course escape is not necessary if jesus cant f you on saturday hell f you next wednesday hey check out my album tacos and bowling on itunes httpphobosapplecomwebobjectsmzstorewoawa viewalbumplaylistid39322321 we all abide

this is one of my favorite films ever amazing performances from virtually everyone so many quotable lines virtually caddyshack level john goodman amazes me every time i see him and shines and rants in every scene of the many cohen bros films most of which are exceptional this is the most fun clever story developed and paced well and just so freaking funnyone of many interesting tidbits the dudes 69 check at the beginning of the film is dated 91191 followed by g bush senior talking on the tv about iraq war the more things changeone last note on the making of the cohens mention joel silver suggested and they ignored that he should get his rug back the rug the catalyst for all subsequent events is not really necessary and this film doesnt need that hollywood closure the dude would just say f it lets go bowlingwhat a brilliant film thats not her toe dude

ive seen it about twenty or so times now and i never get bored with it if you have seen it ever tried explaining to your friends what this movie is about somehow i never manage to really capture the essence of this flick which is part of the attraction i suppose of course there is the basic story line about a guy whose rug has been stolen by some nihilists who hold him for someone else having the same name but to be honest that storyline only serves to piece together the incredibly funny scenes that make up this movie oh boy do i wish i had some of the laidbackness the dude possesses bridges is your parents nightmare and lovable for that goodman and his neverending flirtations with jewish religion and vietnam are so utterly ridiculous without ever being offensive hilarious then there is donny a marvel in his own right the nihilists lebowskis daughter maude and her vaginal art her gayer than gay house friend anton the jesus in his purple shiny training suit the dudes landlord  neighbour the list is almost endless this movie walks the good side of the thin line where cheap stoporillshoot humor leslie nielsen style flicks occupy the opposite sidewatch it watch it again have a ball talking about it with your friends then watch it again together you wont be disappointed its a killer movie highly recommended

is one of those classic films everyone talks about that ive never seen until recently im glad i did this superbly cast comedy features jeff bridges as the dude the unemployed live and let live antagonist who is unfortunately thrust into a series of events beyond his control along with his two best friends and bowling colleges walter and donny played by john goodman and steve buscemi respectively the comedic timing and skillful screenplay are amazing watching these three interact in scenes is beautiful of course there is more to this film than the comedy and the mysterious twists and turns are strong on their own right and the overall lesson learned is heartfelt this really is a classic film brought to us by the coen brothers

this movie is definitely not for everyone some people hate it and some cannot find its humor i find it absolutely hilarious the casting is perfect and the dialog is fun i like the way the characters mesh and clash and completely lose their tempers  john goodman im talking to you  well done it is funny and offensive to some but i like that kind of moviejullianne moore is so great in role of maude lebowskisteve buscemi and philip seymorhoffman also give great performances then of course there is the dude jef bridgesthe most laid back of them all be sure to check out his fashion choices pay special attention to his shoes someone mistakes him for a millionaire and instead of letting the incident go an insane dangerous and funny adventure results how did he get into this mess bowling is known to solve all problems as do white russians but watch out for those nihilists

might actually be the funniest film of all time but only if you like its style of humor parody and subtle offkilter satire even then if you are anything like me you will find it only mildly funny during your first viewing as others have said it really does get funnier each time you watch it probably because you have to know the characters to appreciate much of the humor and because during the first viewing you are burning too much mental energy trying to follow the relatively complex plot while not as complex as millers crossing it still challenges viewers to pay close attention the dvd does not have a commentary but it does have a short feature full of interviews where the coen brothers explain some of their rationale for certain elements in the script and reveal places where the cast put their own individual marks on the filmfeatures the coens trademark comic style they are students of films and their secret is taking a traditional character and creating an incongruity between the way you expect the character to talk and behave as per movie conventions and what actually happens for the coens play with the detective buddy picture and the suspense genres they set up a philip marlowe episodic detective story but as their main character they substitute an aging potsmoking bowler jeff the dude lebowski played by jeff bridges for the film noir detective like marlowe the dude gets caught up in scheme a whole lot bigger than he is and gets episodically pushed and pulled by a lot of strange characters his buddy walter sobchek john goodman is a blustering viet nam veteran who manages to further complicate almost every situation much of the humor comes from the way the supposedly laid back dude continually comes unglued over walters behavior finally the coens incorporate not one but two hitchcock macguffins into the film the series of unfortunate events are set in motion by a rug the floor covering type and midway into the film it is replaced as a motivating factor by a young woman tara reid ultimately neither is of any importance yet they are the reason for everything that happens in the film new lebowski fans can be found drinking white russians entering their local bowling alley for the first time in years looking up nihilist in the dictionary and checking to see if tvland is showing any branded reruns if any of that sounds like fun you should definitely check out the filmthen again what do i know im only a child

easily one of my favorite movies by my favorite actor ive always like jeff bridges but he usually plays someone fairly together and knowing exactly where hes going and how hes going to get there here he may be together in a unique sort of way but he has no idea where hes going and he doesnt care how he gets where ever hes going just going with the flowas with so many great movies every character is a gem and even actors i dont normally like are excellentwhen i first watched this movie i was in a room with my extended family wife inlaws my inlaws inlaws and within 10 minutes all but three of us had left the room overwhelmed by the swearing and a bit disgusted with this character with no apparent redeeming features besides my brotherinlaw and myself my brotherinlaws 80year old jewish motherinlaw stayed at the end of the movie we had all laughed a lot but the best line was reserved for bubby who said ive never heard the word f used in so many interesting ways

writing and directing yet another cult classic the cohen brothers have once again concocted a masterpiece that gets better with every viewing witty intelligent vulgar happy sad runs through the gambit of emotions like few other films can match wrought with eccentric characters throughout the film creates some of the most memorable characters on the tinsel town scene jeffery lebowski jeff bridges who goes by the moniker the dude an unemployed burnout who enjoys driving around bowling and the occasional acid flash back walter sobchak john goodman a vietnam veteran converted jew whos still living in the past of both the vietnam war and his former marriage with his exwife cynthia theodore donald kerabatsos steve buscemi known as donny a california surfer who enjoys bowling always seems a little lost or at best a page behind the rest of the group jeffery lebowski david huddleston the real jeffery lebowski a paraplegic korean war veteran supposed self made millionaire and head of the little lebowski urban achievers foundation who has a penchant for vanity as evidenced by his choice of second wife bunny lebowski tara reid a young beautiful porn star nymphomaniac this is just a glimpse at a few of the movies characters who inadvertently interact together and solidify one of the movies greatest achievements the dialogue the array of characters that the cohen brothers create along with the brilliant casting of each character allows them to script some of the wittiest dialogue of any movie ever written ranging from absurd and vulgar to intelligent and insightful the dialogue flows so naturally and meshes so intricately throughout the movie that multiple viewings are necessary to completely appreciate the skilled craftsmanship of the syntactical and grammatical structure employed by the characters the dude enjoys lifes simple pleasures and leads a normal dysfunctional unproductive life of drinking causal drug use driving around and most importantly league bowling his apartment has a rug a rug that really ties the room together that is until his rug is mitterated upon by two of jackie treehorns thugs in an attempt to recover a sum of money from after a brilliantly crafted brainstorming dialogue session at the bowling alley with his eccentric bowling team walter sobchak and donny the dude decides to rectify his rug situation by going to the real jeffery lebowski whose rug the thugs were really trying to mitterate upon and recover another rug hopefully one that can match the old rugs ability to really tie the room together meeting with contempt and hostility from the dude eventually finagles a rug from the real jeffery lebowskis house this episode marks the beginning of a precarious relationship between the two lebowskis calls upon the dude after receives a ransom note stating that the love of his life bunny lebowski has been kidnapped from here the movie takes twists and turns as the dude acts as courier of the ransom money and finds himself center stage in the whole kidnapping fiasco mainly because he is in a unique position to either confirm or deny the carpet pissers as the identity of the kidnappers as the movie culminates the two lebowskis have a final bout exposing the true nature of each without wasting millions of dollars on special effects to fill in for thin plot lines and fluff for weak scenes and content the cohen brothers displayed their prowess through manipulating language and intelligently designing one of the best movies ever produced every time i watch this movie i find something that i previously missed firmly cements the cohen brothers as hollywood stalwarts in the movie industry

the coen brothers are known for a bizarre sense of humor as are their fans and once again they hit the nail on the head with this filmjeff bridges plays jeffrey the dude lebowski a burned out exhippie who hates the eagles 70s rock group whos biggest joys in life are bowling with his buddies played by john goodman and steve buscemi driving around and the occasional acid flashback he is mistaken for the millionaire jeff lebowksi who owes a lot of debt by two angry mobsters and theywell ruin his favorite rug shall we say he goes to the paralyzed millionaire for retribution for his rug only to become even tangled up in a kidnapping plot which involves a severed pinky toe threats of castration and the death of a car as the dude puts it he enlists the help of his crazy paranoid vietnam veteran walter played by goodman who converted to judiasm also to help him out figure out all the chaos going onthe film is for people with a weird sense of humor this is not your typical hollywood comedy by any sense of the imagination and this does have some pretty rough language in it with the fword being said 251 times recommended for fans of monty python and definitely a must see for fans of the coens brothers as well as jeff bridges

this film could not be better this has to be even better than raising arizona another terrificly witty piece of theirs i love the whole cast sound track silliness and seriousness the whole thing was marvelous there couldnt have been a better choice of th actor for the dude jeff bridges had it down from the very beginning milk drinking scene to the instigation of the whole mystery a few of my favorite scenes being the whole slam dunk and mitterating scene the degradation of the car the nialist in the parking lot the ferret in the bath him listening to the best bowling moments on a walkman the walk along the water with donny in hand just to name a few and who could forget the little hottie the mrs lebowski

it took me a few views before i fully appreciated all the subtleties of this film beyond being humorous from both a character and a situational point of view it has a near genius way of combining the extraordinary with the mundane putting the dude in a situation which he does not fit into at all the outrageous exploits of just about every other character including the dudes friend walter and his rich and powerful counterpart also named jeff lebowski are made even more outrageous in the fact that the dude just wants to lay back smoke a joint and not get involved in any of thisthe overly hyped exaggeration of the mystery plot combined with the extremely downplayed acting of jeff bridges as the dude make this film work on many levels and the irregularities of every character really play off each other especially between john goodman and jeff bridges john as the dudes friend walter is such a huge presence with his wild outbursts and near frantic insanity that it winds up the dudes already seemingly highstrung personality and creates a great contrast that really made me respect johns acting abilitiesoverall the great dialogue both subtle and blatant humor and excellent mix of situational and character comedy make this a film that i will definitely recommend for just about any collection

is a very clever hilarious film that stands up to repeat viewings over and over againthe nature of the film is difficult to specify its a comedy that combines elements of surrealism with a decent sound track and visuals and is carried through with excellent performances by great actors playing very funny but unique roles this is by no means a mainstream comedy the story of this film as you will find out doesnt really stand out but what makes the film good is the acting direction and script which im sure every big lebowski fan will tell you contains some of the best speeches and one liners ever written in my opinionthe cohen brothers in my opinion are fantastic directors for those who do not know and their style can be seen throughout using a very delicate balance of simple cinematography and music that wont excite the viewer but develops a pace which suits this film to perfectionall of the actors are superb steve buscemi jeff bridges and john goodman are all amazing and in my opinion goodman should have one an award for his role in the film the film also contains various other special characters throughout which just works brilliantlythere are very few if any elements to this film that could be improved any angle to any aspect you can think of has been chosen and executed perfectly to leave the viewer happy afterwards and as i said it stands up to repeat viewings i have no idea how many times ive watched it but its a lot perhaps 30 and its still just as funny im in awe of the perfect direction and faultless acting from start to finishi have and would recommend it to anyone and those i have love it too enjoy

just watched the ladykillers and am most disappointed ive one question whats happened fargo great big lebowski even better since then the coen brothers have not produced anything that comes close i dont know why this is but i really wish they could make a movie which is half as good as lebowski stop using a list actors such as hanks and clooney and go back to your roots jeff bridges performance as the dude is a joy to behold cant imagine hanks in that role or clooney as someone who doesnt roll on saturdays i can only think that as their movies gained popularity in the 90s they thought they would up the ante and work with big movie stars and have bigger budgets it hasnt worked please ditch all the movie stars and return to the great character driven quirky movies of which you made your names heres hoping

could you imagine anyone taking care to check the contains spoilers box before submitting a comment on this movie the joys of this movie have so little to do with plot revelations that checking that box would be superfluous even if the comment did reveal spoilers this is the cohen brothers best movie i will make a bold prediction in twenty years fargo will have receded into the shadows of forgotten but once praised films while will still be providing its own unique version of wit and humour to film lovers who appreciate the kind of comedy that comes out of funny characters and organic natural feeling dialogue

is it just me or has this movie progressively gotten better every year since it was released like 8 years agojust the setting of the film the brilliant performances by john goodman jeff bridges phillip seymour hoffman john turturo julianne moore david huddleston millionaire lebowski besides its so well written and is just a riot how many memorable lines can you fit in one movie lebowski is great as an almost tragicflawed hero figure hes a hard luck lazy stoner yet you still get a feeling of greatness from him from some of the things he tells us about his past and from his respected presence in the film hes just truly a classic unforgettable movie character i still think the best role in the film is played by goodman who is absolutely fking brilliant as walter i mean admit it who didnt forgive him for 8 years of roseane on the spot i like the slight philosophical undertext of the film and all the archetypes it portrays between the dude walter the millionaire lebowski maude lebowski nihilism pacifism  and using it all as a punchline is hystericaloh and turturo is immediately in the running for most memorable comedy cameo ever with jesus the perverted foulmouthed shttalker you said it man a true cult classic in every sense

do not watch this movie expecting a nice clean storyline from top to bottom in fact you shouldnt expect anything clean out of this movie including the dudes rug not to say there is no plot to there is its just completely inconsequential this is a flick you want to watch when you dont have much else to do youre feeling kinda relaxed and you have a beer or a white russian in your hands the dude will fascinate you him and all his quirky friendsif you watched it once watch it again the dialogue and the lines are so uniquely funny you will find new subtleties every time you watch it if anyone gives you trouble just say hey easy theres a beverage here

every once in a while there comes a movie that leaves you with the feeling that you have witnessed genius is definitely one of those movies you become entranced from the start by sam elliots opening monologue and it never lets up on first viewing the movie can seem slow confusing and even boring but do not let that stop you from seeing it againis an acquired taste it is very good at first and after a few more viewings it becomes undeniably excellent brilliantly crafted in the style of an old hollywood mystery is one of the funniest and most original movies of all time its craftsmanship is perfect and the actors notably jeff bridges phillip seymore hoffman john torturro steve buscemi julianne moore and john goodman all put up some of the best performances of their careers the script by the coen brothers is truly ingenious and its creativity is awe inspiring there are hilarious subtleties that one only notices after seeing it again and again i have seen the movie 17 times and it honestly gets funnier each time is truly the greatest movie ever made

if you take the time to look through some of the more negative reviews of youll see that a lot of people simply dont get this film frankly i feel sorry for them as they are missing out on one of the funniest smartest films ever made the characters are outlandish and ott and are total losers the dude and walter are definitely antiheroes which many people mostly americans im afraid seem to have a major problem with however european audiences have a great love for the lazy underdog and the dude is typical of such bumbling idiots as inspector cluseau the pink panther films and charlie chaplin which may explain the films success in the uk it has become a cult hit amongst students and is quoted by myself and my friends frequently the film boasts very smart writing and is knowingly bizarre and irreverent the dialogue is fastpaced and witty but slightly offkilter to match the overall pitch of the movie i recommend to anyone who is a fan of the coen brothers work and other films which emphasise wit over action such as withnail and i and lost in translation

joel and ethan coen  well known postmodernists the most famous next to quentin tarantino masters in conventionss jugglery the only hitchcocks successors in the field of suspense for example barton fink once again had a fling at viewer once again we are dealing with film labyrinth full of citations conventions and misleads brothers like always in masterly way changing conventions and all of that  accumulation of extremely funny scenes and episodes funny and witty dialogs and loony characters  drowns in smoke of absurdity the movie is made  like every coens production  very shipshape cinematography of genial roger deakins production design and set decoration also great dennis gassner and acting in the movie we can enjoy such great leading actors as julianne moore jeff bridges his best role great characteristic actors like steve buscemi john goodman or john turturro and also masters in supporting like philip seymour hoffman important fact is that characters played by bridges goodman buscemi and turturro were written specially for these actors

to me the greatest thing about the coen brothers is how vastly different each of their films is for example after making the dark dramatic fargo they made this film  a comedy about a stoner who gets his rug stolen what other filmmakers would make such a leap from film to film and continuing doing so through all of their films only the coen brothersstars jeff bridges as jeffrey lebowski an unemployed man known to everyone as the dude his life revolves around the nights spent bowling with his buddies donny steve buscemi and walter john goodman the latter of which is an easily upset vietnam vet life is good for the dude  until two thugs beat him up and pee on his rug mistaking him for a different jeffrey lebowski the dude goes to visit david huddleston and tells him about it shortly thereafter the dude is beat up by three people hes never met then ordered by to be the courier in an exchange s wife bunny a young tara reid has just been kidnapped from there on things get worse and worse for the dude how hes gonna get himself out of it is anyones guessis really a fantastic film there is a wellwritten clever and funny script  which isnt really a surprise from the coen brothers great directing and cinematography the latter by roger deakins particularly during some wonderfully quirky dream sequences theres also a really cool soundtrack featuring bob dylan ccr and morebut what would the film be without the cast jeff bridges is really great and funny as the dude the real highlight of the cast is probably john goodman who is absolutely hilarious as the dudes overthetop best friend theres also good performances from julianne moore philip seymour hoffman david huddleston and sam elliott coen brothers favorites steve buscemi john turturro and peter stormmare also appearas ive said the thing that is most appealing about the coen brothers are the differences between each of their films is one of their very best its a stoner movie  and its one of the best movies ever made watch it dude you wont regret it

is about a man named the dude jeffrey lebowski who is mistaken for a millionaire with the same exact name and goes through bizarre experiences in an attempt to clear his name this film is a sure enough promise to make your worries be over after watching the movie i thought this film was going to be stupid and sure enough it was but also it was utterly hilarious with smart dialogue and stylish scenes jeff bridges as the dude does a terrific job in the film and his bizarre dreams are greatly acted by him john turturro also had a great role even though he only starred in about two scenes the introduction of him was the funniest scene of the entire movie john goodman steve buscemi and phillip seymour hoffman had good roles too as well this is a stupid funny film and that is entirely why i enjoy it with its slapstick scenes i liked fargo and o brother where art thou but this in my opinion is the best coen film yet i recommend ithedeens outlook 8510  b

without a doubt the funniest film ive ever had the privilege of watching a magical brew concocted from a script overflowing with multinuanced humour masterful directing and a cast with the skill and understanding to pull it offthe plot is a looselyrendered updating of raymond chandlers convoluted detective tales in this film the coen brothers have replaced the genres traditional antihero detective with a drugaddled aging hippie and if that makes any sense then all else flows from there ruminations abound on the ultimate ineffectuality of both the militant and pacifistic factions of americas people the story is played out in front of the backdrop of the gulf war which took place 7 year before the movie was made  giving the characters generally incompetent actions a resonance of futility  the people are not only too ineffectual to change the world they live in they also seem quite content to inhabit their garish world the fact that the characters barely mention the war itself besides walter an exvietnam vet whos fascination with the killing fields knows no boundsreflects on their general apathy  the dude the detective who is really a lazy hippie searching for his rattyassed rugin this tale is from the flowerpower generation yet is completely unconcerned with the state of conflict his country finds itself in  and yet this theme is not overplayed and the laughs come thick and fast intellectual gags observational humour physical comedy running jokes characterbased funny stuff  the strength of the actual comedy content lies in the sheer variety of absurdity the coens manage to address in one film  the two lead characters the dude jeff bridges and walter john goodman are wonderfully written and brilliantly performed the support cast are just as wonderful with julianne moore steve buscemi john turturro and sam elliott all playing their part in keeping the laughs coming the coens also introduce a host of eccentric bitplayers into the mix a gang of cricketbat wielding german nihlists knox harrington the video artist the dudes nervy landlord marty porn king jackie treehorn high school brat larry sellers these seemingly random characters help bring the coen brothers la to vivid life the plot itself is full of redherrings and after laughing ones way through an initial viewing a few questions will be left hanging and indeed some of the characters actions remain unclear after the credits have rolled ie did little larry steal the dudes car  who kepthadlost the millions dollars  was there a million dollars   the whole chain of events is initially precipitated by a case of mistaken identity and noone the viewers the characters seems to know exactly whats going on adding to the freewheelin rambling feel the coens trademark razorsharp dialogue has never been funnier than it is here once youre hooked youll never miss an opportunity to drop one of the endless hilarious quotes into conversation and your friends wont mind as youll have brainwashed them into loving this incredibly clever comedy film too  am i wrong

in their career coen brothers wont again reach the high who they released with this movie  movie based over the vagabond brain of dude and the ironic and without a possible description of the jew walter  but rarely a movie can be remembered for his superb dialogs and sentences as  this aggression will not stand man the bums will always lose have you ever heardof vietnam youre enteringa world of pain son and many others  its as to describe a landscape colored with millions of colors  a way to walk in an alien heaven  its how life should be but the potential is its how life might be  kind of humans with their low vision of this world would not spend a cent as they wouldnt break their ordinary world of fear  fear watching a person who does change own world without pretending to change anything  an anonymous sequence of dna binary in a world ever biggest than the day before  and dude swims in this anonymous world  escaping from sharks  humans which lost from their born that free state primitive painted by jjrousseau in emile  anything of this movie is a huge smile and a long and bitter laugh about this occidental society
